What was Marin's orders?: protect the King's land in the Ohio Valley from the British
What was William Johnson's role in Briti: British Superintendent for Indian Affairs in the New York region and beyond
What was William Johnson's Iroquois name: Warraghiggey, meaning "He who does great things."
Who was added to party as Washington wen: Jacob Van Braam as an interpreter; Christopher Gist, a company surveyor working in the area; and a few Mingo led by Tanaghrisson
What letter did Washington present to S: Dinwiddie demanding an immediate French withdrawal from the Ohio Country
How did Saint-Pierre respond to Washingt: As to the Summons you send me to retire, I do not think myself obliged to obey it.
Why did French feel they had right to Oh: France's claim to the region was superior to that of the British
How many men did Duquesne send to reliev: Contrecœur led 500 men south from Fort Venango on April 5, 1754
Upon learning of a French scounting part: with Tanaghrisson and his party, surprised the Canadians on May 28 in what became known as the Battle of Jumonville Glen
What were casualties of battle?: killed many of the Canadians, including their commanding officer, Joseph Coulon de Jumonville
Why was Tanaghrisson supporting British: regain authority over his own people. They had been inclined to support the French, with whom they had long trading relationships
When did French learn about Braddock's p: plans leaked to France well before Braddock's departure
How did King Louis XV respond to British: dispatched six regiments to New France under the command of Baron Dieskau in 1755.
What were British plans against French?: blockade French ports, sent out their fleet in February 1755
What was the goal of congress?: formalize a unified front in trade and negotiations with various Indians, since allegiance of the various tribes and nations was seen to be pivotal
Was the plan formalized?: The plan that the delegates agreed to was never ratified by the colonial legislatures nor approved of by the crown
What was the importance of the congress?: format of the congress and many specifics of the plan became the prototype for confederation during the War of Independence
Who went to Fort Dusquesne in June 1755?: Braddock (with George Washington as one of his aides) led about 1,500 army troops
How many casualties did British get?: Approximately 1,000 British soldiers were killed or injured.
What difficulties was Shirly having?: efforts to fortify Oswego were bogged down in logistical difficulties, exacerbated by Shirley's inexperience
How did Vaudreuil react when Johnson was: sent Dieskau to Fort St. Frédéric to meet that threat
Who won the battle of Lake George?: inconclusively, with both sides withdrawing from the field
How were British able to cut supplies to: deportation of the French-speaking Acadian population from the area.
What other clashes were involved in taki: Petitcodiac in 1755 and at Bloody Creek near Annapolis Royal in 1757
What proposed attacks did Shirley plan?: capture Niagara, Crown Point and Duquesne, he proposed attacks on Fort Frontenac on the north shore of Lake Ontario
Where was Shirley planning an expedition: through the wilderness of the Maine district and down the Chaudière River to attack the city of Quebec
What plans of the British did this attac: hopes for campaigns on Lake Ontario, and endangered the Oswego garrison
What was Loudoun's plans for 1757?: attack on New France's capital, Quebec
Given the strength of French forces at L: returned to New York amid news that a massacre had occurred at Fort William Henry.
What troops attacked Fort William Henry: French irregular forces (Canadian scouts and Indians)
During withdrawal from Fort William Henr: attacked the British column, killing and capturing several hundred men, women, children, and slaves.
What was causing New France to have issu: British blockade of the French coastline limited French shipping.
Where was Montcalm focusing the defense: St. Lawrence, with primary defenses at Carillon, Quebec, and Louisbourg,
What led to Newcastle's fall from power: British failures in North America, combined with other failures in the European theater
Pitt's plan called for what attacks?: three major offensive actions involving large numbers of regular troops
How many of the Pitt's planned expeditio: Two of the expeditions were successful, with Fort Duquesne and Louisbourg
How many troops were defeated for Britis: 18,000 regulars, militia and Native American allies
What success did Abercrombie gain out of: sent John Bradstreet on an expedition that successfully destroyed Fort Frontenac
What impact did this loss have on Abercr: recalled and replaced by Jeffery Amherst, victor at Louisbourg.
In 1758 what was duc de Choiseul's plan: invasion of Britain, to draw British resources away from North America and the European mainland
How successful was the French revised ef: The invasion failed both militarily and politically, as Pitt again planned significant campaigns against New France
What was the significance of victory at: cut off the French frontier forts further to the west and south
What were requests made to British?: freedom to continue worshiping in their Roman Catholic tradition, continued ownership of their property,
When did the North American French and I: signing of the Treaty of Paris on 10 February 1763
What choice did French have for surrende: continental North American possessions east of the Mississippi or the Caribbean islands of Guadeloupe and Martinique
Why did France choose to give up contine: value of the Caribbean islands' sugar cane to be greater and easier to defend than the furs from the continent
What was the objective of Royal Proclama: outlined the division and administration of the newly conquered territory
What did the loss mean to France?: disappearance of a strong ally and counterweight to British expansion, leading to their ultimate dispossession
What made Ohio Country vulnerable?: military roads to the area by Braddock and Forbes
Where will a canonball dropped from the: behind the foot of the mast
Where does centripetal force go?: toward the center of the curving path
